alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 9:47PM PST until January 15 at 10:54PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Some farm buildings may be threatened and roads covered in low areas by rising water. Expect widespread flooding throughout the Coquille River floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Coquille River Coquille 21.0 19.3 Fri 8 pm PST 20.7 21.9 20.1 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 400 PM PST.
